summary: The Cybersecurity Hiring Modernization Act aims to reform the hiring process for cybersecurity positions within the federal government. It limits the use of educational requirements in evaluating candidates for these roles, allowing them only if mandated by law in the relevant state or locality. The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) is required to publish details on qualification standards and educational attainment data related to these positions. The bill defines “covered positions” as those within the GS-2210 information technology management series and those designated as cybersecurity under the NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework.
